metadata.title: CVE-2024-7055 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg up to 7.0.1. It has been classified ascritical. This affects the function pnm_decode_frame in the library/libavcodec/pnmdec.c. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow.It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has beendisclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 7.0.2 is ableto address this issue. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component.The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-273651.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra61 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec61 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavdevice61 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra10 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter10 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra61 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavformat61 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libavutil59 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libpostproc58 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libswresample5 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
libswscale8 - 7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:7.0.2-1ubuntu1').
